articles.title: Brazilian Communist Party Delegation Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Brazilian Communist Party Delegation Visits DPRK Embassy 
    Pyongyang, October 3 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Brazilian Communist Party headed by Renato Ravello, national chairman of the Central Committee of the party, paid a congratulatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Brasilia on Sept. 27 on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 Noting that the WPK has created a world model in socialist construction and the struggle to defend the sovereignty of the country through its practical activities for the last six decades since its foundation, Renato Ravello said that his party would make every effort to develop the cooperative relations with the DPRK as a coalition ruling party. 
 He sincerely wished General Secretary of the WPK Kim Jong Il good health and sincerely hoped that the WPK and the Korean people greeting its 60th anniversary would achieve fresh success in their struggle to build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation.

articles.title: WPK Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Romania
articles.content:
WPK Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Romania 
    Pyongyang, October 3 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony of the Romanian preparatory committee to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) was held in Bucharest on Sept. 28.
 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania, and Ion Ciuca, chairman of the party, were respectively elected chairman and vice-chairman of the preparatory committee at the inaugural ceremony.
 The preparatory committee decided to hold diverse events on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the WPK.

Seminars on WPK Birthday in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Seminars on WPK Birthday in Foreign Countries 
    Pyongyang, October 3 (KCNA) -- Seminars were held by the People's Rally for Socialism and the Genuine Lumumbist Patriotic Party of Democratic Congo and the Bangladesh People's League on Sept. 26 and 27 on the occasion of the 60th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 Jean Baptiste Nkoy, general secretary of the People's Rally for Socialism of Democratic Congo, and Otete Gaston Mboyo, chairman of the National Committee of the Genuine Lumumbist Patriotic Party of Democratic Congo, in speeches noted that the exploits, might and high dignity of the WPK are unthinkable apart from President Kim Il Sung.
 They referred to the fact that leader Kim Jong Il developed the WPK into the Party of Kim Il Sung and the guiding force for the Songun revolutionary cause, working at its Central Committee for more than four decades.    
 Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, in a report stressed that no force on earth can check the advance of the WPK and the people single-mindedly rallied around Kim Jong Il with the firm guiding idea.    
 Only when the progressive political parties of the developing countries make a deep study of the rich experience of the struggle of the WPK representing the era of independence and apply it to the specific conditions of their countries can they achieve genuine independence and build a true new society, he pointed out.
 A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar held in Bangladesh.
